results.title: Future eaters. Ep. 3: eating the future
results.creator_credit: Richard Keefe, Ian Cuming, Television New Zealand. New Zealand Natural History Unit, North South Productions and ABC-TV (Australia)
results.brief_description: Episode three of a provocative three part ecological history of Australasia based on Dr Tim Flannery’s best selling book of the same name. It focuses on the exploitation for food of flora and fauna resources, firstly by the indigenous populations of Australia and New Zealand and then by European colonists. This episode looks at the introduction of European farming methods and feral creatures by colonists and their catastrophic effect on our local eco systems in the form of the extinction of many native fauna and irreversible damage to much of Australia’s land. Written and presented by Dr Tim Flannery. Further information available at www.abc.net.au/science/future.

results.title: Future eaters. Ep. 2: nomads of the wind
results.creator_credit: Richard Keefe, Ian Cuming, Television New Zealand. New Zealand Natural History Unit, North South Productions and ABC-TV (Australia)
results.brief_description: Episode two of a provocative three part ecological history of Australasia based on Dr Tim Flannery’s best selling book of the same name. It focuses on the exploitation for food of flora and fauna resources, firstly by the indigenous populations of Australia and New Zealand and then by European colonists. This episode looks at the impact of hunting and fishing by Maori before European colonisation. The primeval forests of New Zealand were home to many unique creatures which they devoured to extinction. They also rapidly depleted marine life until they no longer had enough to eat. The result was war over resources, followed by conservation measures to preserve food sources, some of which continue to this day. Written and presented by Dr Tim Flannery. Further information available at www.abc.net.au/science/future.

results.title: Future eaters. Ep. 1: taming the fire
results.creator_credit: Richard Keefe, Ian Cuming, Television New Zealand. New Zealand Natural History Unit, North South Productions and ABC-TV (Australia)
results.brief_description: Episode one of a provocative three part ecological history of Australasia based on Dr Tim Flannery’s best selling book of the same name. It focuses on the exploitation for food of flora and fauna resources, firstly by the indigenous populations of Australia and New Zealand and then by European colonists. This episode looks at the reasons behind the extinction of Australia’s megafauna, the giant marsupials that roamed the continent before human habitation. Presenter Dr Tim Flannery believes that they were wiped out by the Aborigines upon their arrival in Australia 40-60,000 years ago. The extinctions were the catalyst for environmental meltdown, from which the Aborigines made a triumphant recovery. Written and presented by Dr Tim Flannery. Further information available at www.abc.net.au/science/future.

results.title: Future
results.creator_credit: Garry Dunstan, Pat Hunder and It's About Time
results.brief_description:
Episode number 13 of Series “Not suitable for adults”.
Is there life after puberty? This program examines through a series of comic sketches and original songs, the fears and expectations of teenagers as they anticipate leaving school. The future is seen not only as a time of adventure, but uncertainty, where key decisions must be made. School, life at work and the responsibilities of being an adult are highlighted.

results.title: Fuse
results.creator_credit: Marcus Waters, Katherine Shortland, Maia Horniak and AFTRS
results.brief_description:
A young Aboriginal girl wants to revenge the death of her older brother who has died while in jail for a petty crime. He was the only person she had in the world and now, desperately alone and angry, she finds the judge that sentenced her brother.
The film unfolds in the judge’s bachelor apartment where he is tied up and held captive as each of them confront their own judgements and their own pain.
An intense drama between two completely different people in one room over one night unfolds as they both behave in unexpected ways. Human emotions cross between the race, sex and class divide as each rediscover the meaning of loneliness, loss and judgement.
Cast: Shai Pittman, Chris Haywood
